trans-unit.source: Troubleshooting ATA using the ATA database | Microsoft ATA
trans-unit.target: Troubleshooting ATA using the ATA database | Microsoft ATA

trans-unit.source: Describes how you can use the ATA database to help troubleshoot issues
trans-unit.target: Describes how you can use the ATA database to help troubleshoot issues

trans-unit.source: *Applies to: Advanced Threat Analytics version 1.7*
trans-unit.target: *Applies to: Advanced Threat Analytics version 1.7*

trans-unit.source: Troubleshooting ATA using the ATA database
trans-unit.target: Troubleshooting ATA using the ATA database

trans-unit.source: ATA uses MongoDB as its database.
trans-unit.target: ATA uses MongoDB as its database.

trans-unit.source: You can interact with the database using the default command line or using a user interface tool to perform advanced tasks and troubleshooting.
trans-unit.target: You can interact with the database using the default command line or using a user interface tool to perform advanced tasks and troubleshooting.

trans-unit.source: Interacting with the database
trans-unit.target: Interacting with the database

trans-unit.source: The default and most basic way to query the database is using the Mongo shell:
trans-unit.target: The default and most basic way to query the database is using the Mongo shell:

trans-unit.source: Open a command line window and change the path to the MongoDB bin folder.
trans-unit.target: Open a command line window and change the path to the MongoDB bin folder.

trans-unit.source: The default path is: **C:\Program Files\Microsoft Advanced Threat Analytics\Center\MongoDB\bin**.
trans-unit.target: The default path is: **C:\Program Files\Microsoft Advanced Threat Analytics\Center\MongoDB\bin**.

trans-unit.source: Run: `mongo.exe ATA`.
trans-unit.target: Run: `mongo.exe ATA`.

trans-unit.source: Make sure to type ATA with all capital letters.
trans-unit.target: Make sure to type ATA with all capital letters.

trans-unit.source: How to...
trans-unit.target: How to...

trans-unit.source: Syntax
trans-unit.target: Syntax

trans-unit.source: Notes
trans-unit.target: Notes

trans-unit.source: Check for collections in the database.
trans-unit.target: Check for collections in the database.

trans-unit.source: Useful as an end-to-end test to see that traffic is being written to the database and that event 4776 is being received by ATA.
trans-unit.target: Useful as an end-to-end test to see that traffic is being written to the database and that event 4776 is being received by ATA.

trans-unit.source: Get the details of a user/computer/group (UniqueEntity), such as user ID.
trans-unit.target: Get the details of a user/computer/group (UniqueEntity), such as user ID.

trans-unit.source: Find Kerberos authentication traffic originating from a specific computer on a specific day.
trans-unit.target: Find Kerberos authentication traffic originating from a specific computer on a specific day.

trans-unit.source: To get the <ID of the source computer> you can query the UniqueEntity collections, as shown in the example.
trans-unit.target: To get the <ID of the source computer> you can query the UniqueEntity collections, as shown in the example.

trans-unit.source: Each network activity type, for example Kerberos authentications, has its own collection per UTC date.
trans-unit.target: Each network activity type, for example Kerberos authentications, has its own collection per UTC date.

trans-unit.source: Find NTLM traffic originating from a specific computer related to a specific account on a specific day.
trans-unit.target: Find NTLM traffic originating from a specific computer related to a specific account on a specific day.

trans-unit.source: To get the <ID of the source computer> and <ID of the account> you can query the UniqueEntity collections, as shown in the example.
trans-unit.target: To get the <ID of the source computer> and <ID of the account> you can query the UniqueEntity collections, as shown in the example.

trans-unit.source: Each network activity type, for example NTLM authentications, has its own collection per UTC date.
trans-unit.target: Each network activity type, for example NTLM authentications, has its own collection per UTC date.

trans-unit.source: Search for advanced properties such as the active dates of an account.
trans-unit.target: Search for advanced properties such as the active dates of an account.

trans-unit.source: To get the <ID of the account> you can query the UniqueEntity collections, as shown in the example.
trans-unit.target: To get the <ID of the account> you can query the UniqueEntity collections, as shown in the example.

trans-unit.source: The property name that shows the dates in which the account has been active is called: "ActiveDates".
trans-unit.target: The property name that shows the dates in which the account has been active is called: "ActiveDates".

trans-unit.source: For example you may want to know if an account has at least 21 days of activity for the abnormal behavior machine learning algorithm to be able to run on it.
trans-unit.target: For example you may want to know if an account has at least 21 days of activity for the abnormal behavior machine learning algorithm to be able to run on it.

trans-unit.source: Make advanced configuration changes.
trans-unit.target: Make advanced configuration changes.

trans-unit.source: In this example we change the send queue size for all ATA Gateways to 10,000.
trans-unit.target: In this example we change the send queue size for all ATA Gateways to 10,000.

trans-unit.source: The following example provides sample code using the syntax provided above.
trans-unit.target: The following example provides sample code using the syntax provided above.

trans-unit.source: If you are investigating a suspicious activity that occurred on 20/10/2015 and want to learn more about the NTLM activities that "John Doe" performed on that day:
trans-unit.target: If you are investigating a suspicious activity that occurred on 20/10/2015 and want to learn more about the NTLM activities that "John Doe" performed on that day:

trans-unit.source: First, find the ID of "John Doe"
trans-unit.target: First, find the ID of "John Doe"

trans-unit.source: Take a note of his ID as indicated by the value of "`_id`" For our example, let's assume the ID is "`123bdd24-b269-h6e1-9c72-7737as875351`"
trans-unit.target: Take a note of his ID as indicated by the value of "`_id`" For our example, let's assume the ID is "`123bdd24-b269-h6e1-9c72-7737as875351`"

trans-unit.source: Then, search for the collection with the closest date that is before the date you are looking for, in our example 20/10/2015.
trans-unit.target: Then, search for the collection with the closest date that is before the date you are looking for, in our example 20/10/2015.

trans-unit.source: Then, search for John Doe's account NTLM activities:
trans-unit.target: Then, search for John Doe's account NTLM activities:
